subject: Ethics
title: Multinational Tax Ethics
description: A 60-second lesson on Multinational Tax Ethics.

hook.text: Google earned $20 billion in revenue from Australia. It paid less tax there than a local coffee shop chain.

buildup.text: Multinationals use transfer pricingâ€”charging subsidiaries for internal servicesâ€”to shift profit to tax havens.

discovery.text: Ireland, Luxembourg, and the Netherlands became corporate tax havens, attracting trillions in paper profits.

twist.text: Developing nations lose $200 billion yearly to corporate tax avoidanceâ€”more than they receive in foreign aid.

climax.text: The 2021 global minimum tax deal aims to end the race to the bottom. But loopholes are already being found.

punchline.text: Global companies, local loopholes. The profits vanish into thin air.

quiz.question: How do multinationals use transfer pricing to reduce taxes?
options: By paying employees in different currencies
By charging internal subsidiaries to shift profits to low-tax jurisdictions
By donating profits to charity in every country they operate in
